title: New Debt-Collection Rules: What They Mean for Consumers
sub_head: For one thing, they allow debt collectors to contact you on social media. But they have to let you know who they are.
body:
If you recently got a text, email or social-media message from a debt collector, hereâ€™s one of the first things you should do: Make sure you know your rights.
New Consumer Financial Protection Bureau rules, which took effect Nov. 30, clarify how debt collectors can use modern communication methods such as email, text messages and social media to communicate with consumers, among other things.
